Title: Exploring the potential of large-language models (LLMs) for student feedback sentiment analysis
Abstract: large language models  large language model  have demonstrated remarkable performance across a wide range of natural language processing  nlp  tasks including synthetic text generation classification question answering and language translation. in this paper we explore the potential of leveraging these large language model for sentiment analysis or opinion mining of students‚äô feedback about their teachers typically collected at the end of a course. analyzing students‚äô sentiments is crucial for academic decision making. we conducted our study by employing chatgpt a popular large language model to perform sentiment classification on a diverse dataset of student feedback. this dataset was collected and scientifically labeled with sentiment annotations by our experienced annotators team. our findings demonstrate the immense promise of using large language model in accurately classifying students‚äô feedback into positive negative or neutral sentiments. the chatgpt model achieved an impressive overall f1 score of 88% outperforming state of the art deep learning and transformer based models. these results show the significance of large language model in advancing sentiment analysis in educational contexts and provide valuable insights for educators and administrators to enhance the learning experience.
